6.	Emergency Action Plan.
          The facility has:
           a.     A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard
                   29 CFR 1910.38;
           b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and
                   Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III
                  (EPCRA);
           c.     If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility,
                   the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and
                   call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our
                   Emergency Action Plan.

7.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety.
Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions at our facility.   There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.

Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

Facility:  1000-0024-8635	
   1328 N. Hwy 33
   Plattsburg, MO 64477
Contact: Michael O'Connor	
Phone:   816-740-6720

1.	Facility Policy.
The owners, management and employees of Professional Ag Services, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Clinton County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2.	Facility Information.
The primary activity at the facility is the maintenance of company equipment.  At times, for short periods, the fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is stored on site in tanks for distribution to farmers for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  The tanks are designed for the purpose of containing anhydrous ammonia. 

3.	The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario 
An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.	Accidental Release Prevention Program
The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia and state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3 (b).  In the event of an accidental release or emergency it is the policy of Professional Ag Services, Inc. employees to immediately dial 911 to notify local emergency services.  

5.	Five-Year Accident History.
